div.head: Capitulum 1
On penitence, and whyit is called penitence.
div.p: After this penitence should be discussed. Penitence is necessary for the one's posited, so that they might come near.

For it is, as
Jerome says,
the second table after a shipwreck
Hieronymus, Ad Demetriadem, Epist. 130, n. 9 (PL 22, 1115)
because, if someone corrupts by sinning the garments of innocences secured through baptism, he is able to repair them through the remedy of penitence. The first table is baptism, which removes the old man, and introduces the new; the second, is penitence, by which we are restored, while the return to the old is repelled, and the newness fell away is resumed. After baptism, those how have fallen are able to be renewed through penitence, but not through baptism, as man can do penance often, but not baptized.

As baptism is a sacrament, but penitence is also said to be a sacrament and virtue of the mind. For there is interior penance and exterior penance: exterior penance is a sacrament, interior penance is a virtue of the mind, and each is a cause of salvation and justification.
But whether every exterior act of penance is a sacrament, or if not every act which is referred to by this name is a sacrament, will investigate below.

The preaching of John began with penance, saying:
Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand
Matthaeus 3:2 .
But that herald taught, the Truth preach the same after, beginning his sermon from penance
.
